collectionusage: This collection aims to assist users in analyzing and understanding the sentiment of text data.
systemmessage: I am a text-based model trained to assist with various natural language processing tasks. In this collection, I can help you analyze and understand the sentiment of different kinds of text data.
systemmessageusage: You can use these prompts to assess the sentiment of customer reviews, social media comments, or any textual content.

usermessages.title: Basic Sentiment Analysis
usermessages.usage: Best suited for users who want to understand the general sentiment of a piece of text.
usermessages.directive: Please analyze the sentiment of the following text. Output format: markdown.
usermessages.task: How do customers feel about our new product based on this review: 'This is the best thing ever. Highly recommend!'?

usermessages.title: Sentiment of Social Media Comment
usermessages.usage: For users interested in analyzing the sentiment of social media comments.
usermessages.directive: Analyze the sentiment of the following social media comment. Output format: markdown.
usermessages.task: What is the sentiment of this tweet: 'Absolutely terrible experience. Never coming back!'?

usermessages.title: Sentiment Analysis for Emails
usermessages.usage: This prompt is for users who need to gauge the sentiment of an email.
usermessages.directive: Determine the sentiment of the following email text. Output format: markdown.
usermessages.task: Can you tell me the sentiment of this email text: 'Your service has been adequate, nothing exceptional.'?

usermessages.title: Advanced Sentiment Analysis
usermessages.usage: For users looking to analyze sentiment at the sentence level.
usermessages.directive: Analyze the sentiment of each sentence in the following paragraph. Output format: markdown.
usermessages.task: Please analyze the sentiment of each sentence in this review: 'The food was delicious. However, the service left much to be desired.'

usermessages.title: Sentiment Over Time
usermessages.usage: For users interested in tracking sentiment over a period of time.
usermessages.directive: Assess the change in sentiment based on these two reviews. Output format: markdown.
usermessages.task: First review: 'The food was okay, I guess.' Second review after one month: 'The food has improved significantly. Love it now.' What's the change in sentiment?
